tit.cmt: 名を訂正しました。出典；http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%A4%A7%E7%82%8A%E5%BE%A1%E9%96%80%E5%AE%B6%E4%BF%A1 及びhttp://www.geocities.jp/okugesan_com/ooinomikado.htm

sen.j: 大炊御門 家信（おおいのみかど いえのぶ、文政元年6月8日 (旧暦)（1818年7月10日） - 明治18年（1885年）8月30日）は、江戸時代末期の公卿。
sen.e: Ienobu OINOMIKADO (July 10, 1818 - August 30, 1885) was Kugyo (court noble) in the end of Edo period.
Iekoto OINOMIKADO (July 10, 1818 - August 30, 1885) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the end of Edo period.
sen.cmt: 名を訂正しました。court noble→a Court Nobleに訂正しました。
sen.e: Iekoto OINOMIKADO (July 10, 1818 - August 30, 1885) was a Kugyo (a Court Noble) who lived during the end of Edo period.

sen.j: 仁孝天皇（120代）・孝明天皇（121代）・明治天皇（122代）の三朝にわたり仕え、官位は従一位右大臣まで進む。
sen.e: He served the Imperial Court for three reigns, Emperor Ninko (120th), Emperor Komei (121st) and Emperor Meiji (122nd), and was promoted to Juichii Udaijin (Junior First Rank, minister of the right).

He served for the three sovereigns who were the 120th Emperor Ninko, the 121st Emperor Komei and the 122nd Emperor Meiji; He was promoted up to Juichii Udaijin (Junior First Rank and Minister of the Right).
sen.cmt: Imperial Courtを削除しました。Reigns→sovereignsに訂正し、who wereを追加しました。訳抜けのため、promoted up to としました。Junior First Rankのあとにandを追加し、ministerの頭大文字にしました。
sen.e: He served for the three sovereigns who were the 120th Emperor Ninko, the 121st Emperor Komei and the 122nd Emperor Meiji; He was promoted up to Juichii Udaijin (Junior First Rank and Minister of the Right).

sen.j: 父は右大臣大炊御門経久。
sen.e: His father was Udaijin Tsunehisa OINOMIKADO.
His father was Udaijin Tsunehisa OINOMIKADO.
His father was Udaijin Tsunehisa OINOMIKADO.

sen.j: 兄に侍従大炊御門経長、左近衛権中将大炊御門経尚がいる。
sen.e: He had older brothers, Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) Tsunenaga OINOMIKADO and Sakone gon no chujo Tsunenao OINOMIKADO.

He had some older brothers, Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) Tsunenaga OINOMIKADO and "Sakone gon no chujo"(Provisional Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) Tsunenao OINOMIKADO.
sen.cmt: someを追加しました。複数の単語で連なる役職に""を追加しました。定訳より、"Sakone gon no chujo"の訳を追加しました。
sen.e: He had some older brothers, Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) Tsunenaga OINOMIKADO and "Sakone gon no chujo"(Provisional Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) Tsunenao OINOMIKADO.
His wife was a daughter of 松下威久.
His wife was a daughter of 松下威久.
His wife was a daughter of 松下威久.

sen.j: 子に大炊御門経宣 大炊御門師前 大炊御門幾麿、綾小路家政（綾小路家養子）がいる。
sen.e: He had children, 経宣 OINOMIKADO, 師前 OINOMIKADO, Ikumaro OINOMIKADO, Iemasa AYANOKOJI (an adopted child of the Ayanokoji family).
He had several children including 経宣 OINOMIKADO, 師前 OINOMIKADO, Ikumaro OINOMIKADO and Iemasa AYANOKOJI who was the child adopted by the Ayanokoji family).
sen.cmt: several, includingを追加ししました。an adopted child of the Ayanokoji family→who was the child adopted by the Ayanokoji familyに訂正しました。
sen.e: He had several children including 経宣 OINOMIKADO, 師前 OINOMIKADO, Ikumaro OINOMIKADO and Iemasa AYANOKOJI who was the child adopted by the Ayanokoji family).

sen.j: 大炊御門経長の三男として生まれたが、兄二人が早世したため、清華家大炊御門家の嫡男となった。
sen.e: He was born the third son of Tunenaga OINOMIKADO, however, his two older brothers died young, therefore, he became a legitimate son of the Oinomikado family of the Seiga family (the second highest family status for court nobles).

He was born to be the third son of Tunenaga OINOMIKADO; Because his two older brothers died young, he became heir to the Oinomikado family and the Seiga family (the second highest family status for the court noble).
sen.cmt: born→born to be, a legitimate son→heirに訂正しました。Howeverを削除し、Becauseを追加しました。２つの家の間にandを追加しました。
sen.e: He was born to be the third son of Tunenaga OINOMIKADO; Because his two older brothers died young, he became heir to the Oinomikado family and the Seiga family (the second highest family status for the court noble).

sen.j: 文政2年（1819年）に叙爵してから清華家当主として早いスピードで昇進し、侍従・右近衛権少将・左近衛権中将などを歴任。
sen.e: After he was conferred a peerage in 1819, he was quickly promoted as the family head of the Seiga family, and he successively took various posts such as Jiju, Ukone no Gon no shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and Sakone gon no chujo (Provisional Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After he was conferred a peerage in 1819, being the head of the Seiga family, he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period; He held different positions such as Jiju, "Ukone no Gon no shosho" (Provisional Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and "Sakone gon no chujo" (Provisional Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 誤訳です。he was quickly promoted as the family head of the Seiga familyの部分を訂正しました。各文を;でつなぎました。Various→differentに訂正しました。複数単語で連なった役職に""を追加しました。Post→positionに訂正しました。
sen.e: After he was conferred a peerage in 1819, being the head of the Seiga family, he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period; He held different positions such as Jiju, "Ukone no Gon no shosho" (Provisional Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and "Sakone gon no chujo" (Provisional Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 文政11年（1828年）に元服し、天保2年（1831年）には従三位となり、公卿に列する。
sen.e: In 1828, he celebrated his coming of age, and then he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1831 and ranked with Kugyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1828, he did "genpuku" (celebrated his coming of age); He became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1831, which gave him the title Kugyo.
sen.cmt: did "genpuku"を追加しました。and thenを削除し、各文を;でつなぎました。Afterを追加し、andを削除しました。Ranked withをwas given the titleに訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1828, he did "genpuku" (celebrated his coming of age); He became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1831, which gave him the title Kugyo.

sen.j: その後、踏歌節会外弁や権中納言を経て、安政元年（1854年）には権大納言に列した。
sen.e: After he took the posts of Toka no sechie Geben (a kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie (Imperial Court Ceremony)) and Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state), he was ranked with Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) in 1854.

After he took the positions which were "Toka no sechie Geben" (Kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court Ceremony]) and then "Gon Chunagon" (Provisional Vice-Councilor of State), he was given the title "Gon Dainagon" (Provisional Chief Councilor of State) in 1854.
sen.cmt: Post→positionに訂正しました。Which were, thenを追加しました。各役職に""を追加し、()内のカッコを[]に訂正しました。Ranked withをwas given the titleに訂正しました。
sen.e: After he took the positions which were "Toka no sechie Geben" (Kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court Ceremony]) and then "Gon Chunagon" (Provisional Vice-Councilor of State), he was given the title "Gon Dainagon" (Provisional Chief Councilor of State) in 1854.

sen.j: 安政5年（1858年）には日米修好通商条約へ勅許を出すことに反対するため、中山忠能・岩倉具視らとともに八十八卿の一人として抗議の列参をし、勅許を阻止した（廷臣八十八卿列参事件）。
sen.e: In 1858, he joined the demonstration against Imperial sanction for Treaty of amity and commerce between the United States and Japan as one of the member of hachiju-hachi kyo (eighty-eight retainers of Imperial Court) with Tadayasu NAKAYAMA and Tomomi IWAKURA and prevented the Imperial sanction (Demo of eighty-eight retainers of Imperial Court).

In 1858, he attended the demonstration that claimed to prevent the Imperial sanction to be issued for the Treaty of amity and commerce between the United States and Japan, as he was one of the members of "hachiju-hachi kyo" (the eighty-eight retainers of Imperial Court) which included Tadayasu NAKAYAMA and Tomomi IWAKURA who also attended the demonstration; This affair was called "Demo of eighty-eight retainers of Imperial Court."
sen.cmt: 訳抜けです。 that claimed to prevent the Imperial sanction to be issued を追加しました。as he was, which included, who also attended the demonstration を追加しました。; This affair was calledを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1858, he attended the demonstration that claimed to prevent the Imperial sanction to be issued for the Treaty of amity and commerce between the United States and Japan, as he was one of the members of "hachiju-hachi kyo" (the eighty-eight retainers of Imperial Court) which included Tadayasu NAKAYAMA and Tomomi IWAKURA who also attended the demonstration; This affair was called "Demo of eighty-eight retainers of Imperial Court."

sen.j: しかしそれが原因で同年井伊直弼による政治弾圧「安政の大獄」に連座する。
sen.e: This caused him to be involved in political oppression "Ansei no Taigoku (suppression of extremists by the Shogunate)" by Naosuke II in the same year.
This caused him to be often caught as a rebel under the political oppression which was called "Ansei no Taigoku" (the suppression of extremists by the Shogunate) led by Naosuke II in the same year.
sen.cmt: the, led追加、"の位置変更しました。
sen.e: This caused him to be often arrested as a rebel under the political oppression which was called "Ansei no Taigoku" (the suppression of extremists by the Shogunate) led by Naosuke II in the same year.

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年）に右近衛大将・右馬寮御監となる。
sen.e: In 1863, he became Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Umaryo gogen (Inspector of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses).
In 1863, he became "Ukone no daisho" (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and "Umaryo gogen" (Inspector of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses).
sen.cmt: 各役職に""を追加しました。
sen.e: In 1863, he became "Ukone no daisho" (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and "Umaryo gogen" (Inspector of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses).

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）に内大臣、さらに右大臣に就任した。
sen.e: In 1867, he took posts as Naidaijin (minister of the center) and Udaijin (minister of the right).
In 1867, he assumed the positions which were Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) and then Udaijin (Minister of the Right).
sen.cmt: took posts as→assumed the positions which wereに訂正しました。各役職の頭文字を大文字に訂正しました。And thenを追加しました。
sen.e: In 1867, he assumed the positions which were Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) and then Udaijin (Minister of the Right).

sen.j: 明治元年（1868年）に任職を辞す。
sen.e: In 1868, he resigned his posts.
In 1868, he resigned the positions.
sen.cmt: his posts→the positionsに訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1868, he resigned the positions.

sen.j: 以降は政界を引退し、京都西殿町北側で暮らした。
sen.e: After that, he retired from the political world, and lived in the north of 西殿町, Kyoto City.
Since then, being away from politics, he spent his retirement in the north of 西殿町, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: After that→Since then, he retired from the political world, and lived→being away from politics, he spent his retirementに訂正しました。京都の西殿町なのか、京都西の殿町なのか不明です。
sen.e: Since then, being away from politics, he spent his retirement in the north of 西殿町, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 子の幾麿が侯爵に叙せられた。
sen.e: His son, Ikumaro was conferred a peerage.
His son, Ikumaro was conferred a peerage.
His son, Ikumaro was conferred a peerage.
